format.name: KeywordsPresenceChecker
format.description: The argument value must include the keywords: ['separate', 'odd', 'bad', 'usual', 'sudden']. Each keyword must appear at least once, in any order. Case does not matter.

fn_schema.name: fn44__0__unit_conversion_convert
fn_schema.description: Convert a value from one unit to another.

from_unit.description: The unit to convert from. The argument value must include the keywords: separate, odd, bad, usual, sudden. Each keyword must appear at least once, in any order. Case does not matter.

user_queries: I'm trying to follow a recipe from a British cookbook, and it calls for 250 grams of flour, but all I have is a measuring cup with units in ounces. Could you please help me convert 250 grams to ounces so I know how much flour to use?

For a science experiment, I need to measure 3.5 liters of water, but my measuring instrument is marked only in gallons. Could you tell me what 3.5 liters is when converted to gallons so I can be accurate?

I have a fitness tracking app that measures my running distance in miles, but I'm more familiar with kilometers. For my morning run today, I covered 4.7 miles. Can you convert 4.7 miles into kilometers so I know exactly how far I ran?

While working on my home improvement project, I'm required to cut a piece of wood to be 120 centimeters long, but my tape measure uses inches. Could you convert 120 centimeters to inches for me so I can measure it out correctly?

I bought a large package of apples that weighs 10 pounds, but my recipe only calls for 4.5 kilograms of apples. Could you please convert 10 pounds into kilograms so I know if I have enough apples for my recipe?
